page.title: 18Wildlife in Screel Area 2
page.content: species, smaller and lighter than the forest deer. We were also very lucky to see a couple of rabbits. Rabbits try to find sheltered places to live as much as possible for example at the foot of the hill or at the edge of the forest. They usually eat grass, clover and heather they mostly eat their food at dusk and dawn. Rabbits are sometimes known as pests because they eat farmers crops and they are not particularly popular. We also saw pheasants like the ones at Gelston Estate. Thousands of reared pheasants are released every year by gamekeepers into woods in preparation for the shooting season starting on October 1st. The male bird has lovely colourful markings. However the female has only brown markings.
